## Adding Content

Populate your file with course content, figures and code snippets directly.

For basic Markdown synthax tutorials, refer to the [Quarto Docs](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/markdown-basics.html)

### Figures

To insert figures, use the following syntax

`![UNIGE](images/unige.png)`

This will display your image as:

![UNIGE logo](images/unige.png)

NB: to make sure the caption is aligned with the logo, create a `styles.css` file and add the following:

```css
figcaption {
  text-align: center;
}
```

And reference it in your YAML header:
```yaml
---
title: "Chapter I"
format:
  html:
    css: styles.css
---
```
### Code
To insert code snippets, use the following syntax:

```{python}
#| echo: fenced

#| label: fig-polar
#| fig-cap: "A line plot on a polar axis"

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'}
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()
```


This code will be executed when compiling the documents, and the plot will be displayed below the code.
If you just want to show the code snippet without executing it, you should add ""#| eval: false
" :

```{python}
#| echo: fenced
#| eval: false

#| label: fig-polar
#| fig-cap: "A line plot on a polar axis"

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'}
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()
```

### Preview
To preview the content, you can use the "Preview" button if you are working with VS Code.

Alternatively, if you prefer using the command line, navigate to your project and type in:

```bash
quarto preview .\index.qmd
```
